refine_clusters: refine clustering using reference data

Source: R/refine_clusters.R
refine_clusters.Rd

refine_clusters: refine clustering using reference data

refine_clusters(expr_mat, sc_cluster, bulk_mat, lambda = 0.5, epsilon = 1,
  if_compute_sigma = TRUE, num_iteration = 100, default_similiarity = -5,
  disagreement_freq = 0.001, if_plot = FALSE, tsne_coord = NULL,
  cluster_names = NULL, compute_method, ...)

Arguments

expr_mat

input single cell data after gene subsetting
sc_cluster

initial clustering assignment. Note that the number of bulk cell types must be no more than the number of clusters. for additional clusters, there is an assignment of default_similiarity
bulk_mat

input bulk data after gene subsetting
lambda

control parameters
epsilon

control parameters
if_compute_sigma

whether compute the standard deviation of each gene's expression within each cluster. If not, the function assumes that all standard deviations equal to 1.
num_iteration

maximal number of iteration before exiting the algorithm
default_similiarity

default similarity score if there is no reference data to compare to
disagreement_freq

maximal fraction of changes in cluster assignment after one iteration to be considered as converged.
if_plot

whether to plot the clustering result at each iteration.
tsne_coord

t-SNE coordinate of every cells for plotting
compute_method

corr_coef
...

control parameters for calculating similarity score
cluster_name

Name of each cluster for plotting

Contents

  • Arguments
